caption: The Eiffel Tower's intricate lattice structure rises gracefully against the Parisian sky.  Its majestic presence inspires awe and wonder in all who behold it.  The tower's elegant design is a testament to human ingenuity and artistic vision.  Visitors from around the world flock to experience its breathtaking views and cultural significance.  It stands as a timeless symbol of romance, innovation, and the enduring spirit of France.
Can experience a great view of the Eiffel tower from the garden. There were construction/ maintenance works going on when I visited. Will visit again when works finish.

For me, this area is perfect if you want the eifel tower to be a background without any hassle because there are not many people in this area. You can also have a picnic here, bring food, wine and mats, but there are no public toilets.

A beautiful park, well worth visiting and exploring if you're there to see the Eiffel Tower! There is so much space, so it did not feel overcrowded while I was there. There are lots of benches to sit down on, and places on the ground to sit. There is a playground for children, a basketball court, and other recreational sites. When I was there, there weren't a lot of bathrooms available, so keep that in mind before you go. The park is incredible with lots of big trees and cool nature sights to see. You won't regret a visit!

"I recently visited Champ de Mars, and it was the perfect spot to relax and enjoy the beauty of Paris. The large, open green space offers a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower, making it a great place for picnics or a peaceful walk. Whether you're a solo traveler, with family, or a couple, you'll love the atmosphere here. There are plenty of benches, and it's easy to find a nice spot to sit and watch the world go by. The area is clean, well-maintained, and offers fantastic photo opportunities. Highly recommend visiting in the early morning or at sunset for the best experience. A must-see when in Paris!"

Best place to have a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower! Champ de Mars is the perfect spot to relax and soak in the beauty of Paris. Whether you’re enjoying a picnic, taking a stroll, or simply sitting on the grass, the atmosphere is serene and picturesque. It’s especially magical at sunset or when the Eiffel Tower sparkles at night. Plenty of space to spread out, and the nearby cafés make it easy to grab a coffee or snack to enjoy while taking in the view. Highly recommend this spot for anyone visiting Paris!
So much so see. You can easily spend the whole day there. Very busy and wear comfortable shoes as is a long walk but well worth it.

Beautiful park with a nice view of the Effile Tower. Although during the Olympics it was extra crowded with some areas closed, it was still a wonderful sight to see. If you're ever in Europe or France it's a must see!
I love going there to have a stroll and see the eiffel as well as people walking around. There are some great view points of the tower. Watch out for scammers though as they are everywhere.

This striking metallic landmark offers stunning views from all angles. It's a popular tourist destination, with crowds often gathered outside hoping to enter the courtyard. The scenic surroundings make it a perfect spot to relax and enjoy a vacation.

We were there during the Olympics so it was really crowded an much of it was blocked off. So please keep that in mind with this review. I am sure it is much better when all of this is not going on. The tower itself is just amazing and so much bigger than you can imagine. The park seems really nice of what we could see. This is definitely a must do when visiting Paris. Would recommend and will definitely be back on our next visit when it is not so busy and blocked off.

I was at the Champ de Mars during the 2024 Olympic games. It was the venue for the beach volleyball games. Though everything was temporarily set up for the games, it did have wide grassy areas, wildflower gardens and if course the Eiffel Tower as it's back drop! I imagine if the temporary venue wasn't there, that it would be even more beautiful the relax and take in the vibe if Paris!
At night taking pictures is amazing beautiful,  no need to pay for any fee. It's free to walk around. Lots of scammers and pick pockets around, be careful.

It is a wonderful place to visit. Lovely garden to sit and have picnic 🧺. Very busy around the Eiffel tower . Be careful with pickpocketers. There are few food stalls. The night view of the Eiffel tower 🗼 is beautiful with lights. There is boat 🚢 trip …

Champ de Mars is a sprawling public greenspace located at the foot of the iconic Eiffel Tower, making it one of the most picturesque parks in Paris. This beautifully landscaped area offers breathtaking views of the tower and serves as a perfect spot for relaxation, picnics, and leisurely strolls.  The park is lined with manicured lawns, blooming flowerbeds, and tree-lined pathways, providing a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. It’s an ideal location for families, couples, and tourists alike, with ample space for children to play and for visitors to take in the stunning Parisian scenery.  During the warmer months, Champ de Mars is alive with activity, as locals and tourists gather for outdoor games, sunbathing, and enjoying the vibrant atmosphere. The proximity to nearby cafés and food stalls makes it easy to grab a snack or drink while soaking up the sun.  As the sun sets, the views of the Eiffel Tower sparkling in the evening light are simply magical, making Champ de Mars a must-visit destination for anyone looking to experience the charm of Paris.
Very beautiful place, not crowded. Lots of ducks and pidgeons because people keep feeding them 🤣 The bathrooms are a little crowded and it could have many more places to sit down and rest/relax. …

Beautiful park with an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower. During the 2024 Olympics they had a temporary venue for beach volleyball that had spectacular views. Such an incredible location and a must visit on any Paris trip.

It's being worked on, probably after some of the Olympic Games events were held there, so it's not the best  place for a picnic right now. Anyway, there's still some room for nice pictures of the Eiffel Tower.
No better place to see the Eiffel Tower. Even if I have seen the Eiffel Tower many times it is always impressive again when we see it again after a long time.

A large public park located near the Eiffel Tower in Paris. It’s perfect for a stroll, picnic, or taking photos with the iconic Eiffel Tower as your background. The atmosphere is relaxing and pleasant, but be cautious of pickpockets as it’s a popular spot for tourists.
Was a great experience....extremely busy so I advise booking early! The facelift of the Eiffel Tower was really well done, it was practically glowing!
Magical, thriving place due to France's iconic symbol, the Eiffel Tower being there.  Great to see during the day, fantastic illumination at night.

Champ de Mars is a beautiful, expansive park with stunning views of the Eiffel Tower. It’s perfect for a leisurely stroll, picnic, or simply relaxing on the grass. However, it can get crowded with tourists, especially during peak times. The area is well-maintained, though some parts could use more care. Despite the crowds, it’s a must-visit spot in Paris for the iconic views and a peaceful break from the city’s hustle.

We chose the tickets that let you take the elevator all the way to the top. Definitely the way to go!! Also, on the way down we decided to forgo the elevator and took the stairs down - it was the best of both worlds and an amazing experience! This is our third time in Paris and every time we come here we visit the Eiffel Tower. The views and the experience never gets old. It is a must-do for every tourist!
Don't think it needs any explanations. It was cleaner and more beautiful than I thought. Checked off my bucket list!

Overall a really disappointing tourist attraction. Totally not how I imagined it. It's only security guards and fences everywhere, trash everywhere, plastic bottles lingering in the water, really disgusting place. The only thing good here is the view from the Eiffel tower. Don't get online stair tickets if there is no elevator tickets left, as it is almost guaranteed to be able to get elevator tickets on the spot.
The great aspect of this hotel is the location. Walking distance from the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are adequate at best. Breakfast spread is decent.
Stunning views of the Eiffel Tower. Just at the bottom of the tower. Very crowded.

Lots of construction near the Eiffel Tower so it’s a bit messy there. Also they need to do something about all the people trying to scam tourists there. If you go there just avoid talking to anyone who’s trying to sell you something or trying to make you sign something.

Very vast area. It was very busy because of the olympics and even though the charm of Paris was still there. We walked from École Militaire to the Eiffel Tower going thru Le Champ de Mars. We noticed a lot of empty appartements and residentials. I was this time playing tourists in my own town..lol
Great experience. Enjoyed the Efiel Tower. Great walk around park area. Currently a Christmas market around
Very pleasant seesite, people who work there are great. If you have problem with mobility, they offer you a elivetor. It's one of the kind of experience.
It's a beautiful location to enjoy looking at the Eiffel tower and take pictures!

Great park in general, always full of people picnicking and hanging out, and right under the Tour Eiffel which is wonderful... Minus one star for now, as much of the park is blocked off or covered in construction for the Olympics. We access from the north side of the park right by the tower, after walking around for a while looking for an entrance.  There are guys with buckets of wine bottles all over the place selling wine and beer, which could be cool if you want that, but also can be a complete nuisance...  The upside-down guy photo is an attempt to get the tower to stick out between his legs in their camera. Good idea?

Terrible experience. Almost everything is behind a metal walls or other kind of walls, no info for tourists where to go where is closed and why. Many months after olimpics and they still cant clean this disster of organization and mess. The fields are pretty much not accessible. If you are going to Eiffel tower then u have to go right next to the fields ( better go Through city) But beware that you will constantly see metal walls separating the fields and closing aby entrance and if it rains slightly then everything in side alleys is ankle deep water. Not to mention rats running at night, not 1 not 2 not 3. They live there and just constantly run around. Also under the tower directly on the sidewalk:) Paris is just a piece of trash now sadly
A bit of a cold day, but no lines getting up to top.  Absolutely spectacular views of Paris, especially all the venue preparations for the Olympics.
They must be working on the park because most of it was closed off with large gates.  The picture from the top shows they may be working on the sod.  I’m sure it’s a great park when open.
Amazing place to visit in Paris. Walking distance from central Station. Built on hill, you can view entire city from the top. Exit to nice lines of Paris.
